title: Oval Cluster KS2 Mission to Space 2013/4
abstractText:
Aims;

1) To broaden children's knowledge and understanding of the solar system and space science
2) To increase children's engagement in Science
3) To develop children's skills in research, teamwork, communication, presentation, ICT and data handling.
4) To develop local networks between teachers teaching Science to Key Stage 2 pupils
5) To develop teacher's understanding of the solar system and space science
6) To encourage teachers to use diverse interactive creative methods to teach primary space science
7) To increase parental engagement in children's learning in science
8) To further develop the Home- School partnership

The impact of our project will be that the children involved know and understand more about the solar system and space, they are more engaged with their science learning, and they have developed their skills of working together in groups, presenting research, using ICT and presenting data in graphs and charts. Teachers will develop a local network of KS2 science co-ordinators and teachers, and will share resources, ideas, good practice and contacts. They will also have a range of new ideas to help them in the teaching of space science in future years.
